snippet: A study commissioned by the American Farm Bureau suggests that changes to immigration law focusing solely on enforcement will lead to a sharp rise in food prices.
abstract: Study commissioned by the American Farm Bureau, nation's largest farm lobby organization, finds that immigration reform focused solely on enforcement could cut agriculture production and cause a sharp rise in food prices; study comes as Congress and Obama administration are debating immigration overhaul proposals.
lead_paragraph: A study commissioned by the American Farm Bureau suggests that changes to immigration law focusing solely on enforcement will lead to a sharp rise in food prices.
